tags.name: igc-avatar
tags.description:
An avatar component is used as a representation of a user identity
typically in a user profile.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Renders an icon inside the default slot.

Attributes:

  * `src` {`string`} - The image source to use.

  * `alt` {`string`} - Alternative text for the image.

  * `initials` {`string`} - Initials to use as a fallback when no image is available.

  * `shape` {`"circle" | "rounded" | "square"`} - The shape of the avatar.

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

Properties:

  * `tagName` {`"igc-avatar"`} -

  * `classes` {`{ circle: boolean; rounded: boolean; square: boolean; small: boolean; medium: boolean; large: boolean; }`} -

tags.name: igc-button
tags.description:
Represents a clickable button, used to submit forms or anywhere in a
document for accessible, standard button functionality.

Events:

  * `igcFocus` {} - Emitted when the button gains focus.

  * `igcBlur` {} - Emitted when the button loses focus.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Renders the label of the button.

  * `prefix` {} - Renders content before the label of the button.

  * `suffix` {} - Renders content after the label of the button.

Attributes:

  * `variant` {`"flat" | "contained" | "outlined" | "fab"`} - Sets the variant of the button.

  * `type` {`"button" | "reset" | "submit"`} - The type of the button. Defaults to undefined.

  * `href` {`string`} - The URL the button points to.

  * `download` {`string`} - Prompts to save the linked URL instead of navigating to it.

  * `target` {`"_blank" | "_parent" | "_self" | "_top" | undefined`} - Where to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context.

  * `rel` {`string`} - The relationship of the linked URL.
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the button is disabled.

  * `aria-label` {`string`} - 

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

Properties:

  * `tagName` {`"igc-button"`} - 

  * `styles` - 

  * `variant` {`"flat" | "contained" | "outlined" | "fab"`} - Sets the variant of the button.

  * `shadowRootOptions` {`{ delegatesFocus: boolean; mode: ShadowRootMode; slotAssignment?: SlotAssignmentMode | undefined; customElements?: CustomElementRegistry | undefined; }`} - 

  * `nativeElement` {`HTMLElement`} -

  * `type` {`"button" | "reset" | "submit"`} - The type of the button. Defaults to undefined.

  * `download` {`string`} - Prompts to save the linked URL instead of navigating to it.

  * `target` {`"_blank" | "_parent" | "_self" | "_top" | undefined`} - Where to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context.

  * `rel` {`string`} - The relationship of the linked URL.
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the button is disabled.

  * `ariaLabel` {`string`} - 

  * `classes` {`{ flat: boolean; outlined: boolean; contained: boolean; fab: boolean; small: boolean; medium: boolean; large: boolean; disabled: boolean; }`} - 

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

tags.name: igc-calendar
tags.description:
Represents a calendar that lets users
to select a date value in a variety of different ways.

Events:

  * `igcChange` {} - Emitted when calendar changes its value.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The default slot for the calendar.

  * `title` {} - Renders the title of the calendar header.

Attributes:

  * `hide-outside-days` {`boolean`} - Controls the visibility of the dates that do not belong to the current month.

  * `hide-header` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the calendar hides its header. Even if set to false, the header is not displayed for `multiple` selection.

  * `header-orientation` {`"vertical" | "horizontal"`} - The orientation of the header.

  * `orientation` {`"vertical" | "horizontal"`} - The orientation of the multiple months displayed in days view.

  * `visible-months` {`number`} - The number of months displayed in days view.

  * `active-view` {`"days" | "months" | "years"`} - The active view.

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

  * `value` {`Date | undefined`} - Тhe current value of the calendar.
Used when selection is set to single.

  * `values` {`Date[] | undefined`} - Тhe current values of the calendar.
Used when selection is set to multiple or range.

  * `selection` {`"single" | "multiple" | "range"`} - Sets the type of date selection.

  * `show-week-numbers` {`boolean`} - Show/hide the week numbers.

  * `week-start` {`"sunday" | "monday" | "tuesday" | "wednesday" | "thursday" | "friday" | "saturday"`} - Sets the start day of the week.

  * `active-date` {`Date`} - Sets the date which is shown in view and is highlighted. By default it is the current date.

  * `locale` {`string`} - Sets the locale used for formatting and displaying the dates in the calendar.

Properties:

  * `styles` - 

  * `tagName` {`"igc-calendar"`} - 

  * `formatterMonth` {`DateTimeFormat`} - 

  * `formatterWeekday` {`DateTimeFormat`} - 

  * `formatterMonthDay` {`DateTimeFormat`} -

  * `hideHeader` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the calendar hides its header. Even if set to false, the header is not displayed for `multiple` selection.

  * `headerOrientation` {`"vertical" | "horizontal"`} - The orientation of the header.

  * `orientation` {`"vertical" | "horizontal"`} - The orientation of the multiple months displayed in days view.

  * `visibleMonths` {`number`} - The number of months displayed in days view.

  * `activeView` {`"days" | "months" | "years"`} - The active view.

  * `formatOptions` {`Pick<DateTimeFormatOptions, "month" | "weekday">`} - The options used to format the months and the weekdays in the calendar views.

  * `resourceStrings` {`IgcCalendarResourceStrings`} - The resource strings.

  * `yearPerPage` {`18 | 15`} - 

  * `previousButtonLabel` {`string`} - 

  * `nextButtonLabel` {`string`} - 

  * `handleKeyDown` - 

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

  * `calendarModel` -

Used when selection is set to single.

  * `values` {`Date[] | undefined`} - Тhe current values of the calendar.
Used when selection is set to multiple or range.

  * `selection` {`"single" | "multiple" | "range"`} - Sets the type of date selection.

  * `showWeekNumbers` {`boolean`} - Show/hide the week numbers.

  * `weekStart` {`"sunday" | "monday" | "tuesday" | "wednesday" | "thursday" | "friday" | "saturday"`} - Sets the start day of the week.

  * `activeDate` {`Date`} - Sets the date which is shown in view and is highlighted. By default it is the current date.

  * `locale` {`string`} - Sets the locale used for formatting and displaying the dates in the calendar.

  * `disabledDates` {`DateRangeDescriptor[]`} - Gets/sets disabled dates.

tags.name: igc-dropdown
tags.description:
Represents a DropDown component.

Events:

  * `igcChange` {} - Emitted when the selected item changes.

  * `igcOpening` {} - Emitted just before the dropdown is open.

  * `igcOpened` {} - Emitted after the dropdown is open.

  * `igcClosing` {} - Emitter just before the dropdown is closed.

  * `igcClosed` {} - Emitted after closing the dropdown.

Slots:

  * `target` {} - Renders the dropdown's target element.

  * ` ` {} - Renders the dropdown list items.

Attributes:

  * `keep-open-on-select` {`boolean`} - Whether the dropdown should be kept open on selection.

  * `scroll-strategy` {`"scroll" | "block" | "close"`} - Determines the behavior of the component during scrolling the container.

  * `keep-open-on-outside-click` {`boolean`} - Whether the component should be kept open on clicking outside of it.

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Sets the open state of the component.

  * `placement` {"top" | "top-start" | "top-end" | "bottom" | "bottom-start" | "bottom-end" | "right" | "right-start" | "right-end" | "left" | "left-start" | "left-end"} - The preferred placement of the component around the target element.

  * `position-strategy` {`"absolute" | "fixed"`} - Sets the component's positioning strategy.

  * `flip` {`boolean`} - Whether the component should be flipped to the opposite side of the target once it's about to overflow the visible area.
When true, once enough space is detected on its preferred side, it will flip back.

  * `distance` {`number`} - The distance from the target element.

  * `same-width` {`boolean`} - Whether the dropdown's width should be the same as the target's one.

  * `pattern` {`string`} - The pattern attribute of the control.

  * `invalid` {`boolean`} - Controls the validity of the control.

  * `minlength` {`number`} - The minlength attribute of the control.

tags.name: igc-mask-input
tags.description:
A masked input is an input field where a developer can control user input and format the visible value,
based on configurable rules

Events:

  * `igcInput` {} - Emitted when the control receives user input

  * `igcChange` {} - Emitted when an alteration of the control's value is committed by the user

  * `igcFocus` {} - Emitted when the control gains focus

  * `igcBlur` {} - Emitted when the control loses focus

Slots:

  * `prefix` {} - Renders content before the input

  * `suffix` {} - Renders content after the input

  * `helper-text` {} - Renders content below the input

Attributes:

  * `dir` {`"ltr" | "rtl" | "auto"`} - The direction attribute of the control.

  * `invalid` {`boolean`} - Controls the validity of the control.

  * `value-mode` {`"raw" | "withFormatting"`} - Dictates the behavior when retrieving the value of the control:

- `raw` will return the clean user input.
- `withFormatting` will return the value with all literals and prompts.

  * `mask` {`string`} - The mask pattern to apply on the input.

  * `prompt` {`string`} - The prompt symbol to use for unfilled parts of the mask.

  * `value` {`string`} - The value of the input.

Regardless of the currently set `value-mode`, an empty value will return an empty string.

  * `name` {`string`} - The name attribute of the control.

  * `outlined` {`boolean`} - 

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Makes the control a required field.

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Makes the control a disabled field.

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - The placeholder attribute of the control.

  * `label` {`string`} - The label for the control.

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

tags.name: igc-circular-gradient
tags.description:
Used for defining gradient stops in the igc-circular-progress.
For each `igc-circular-gradient` defined as `gradient` slot of `igc-circular-progress` element would be created a SVG stop element.
The values passed as `color`, `offset` and `opacity` would be set as
`stop-color`, `offset` and `stop-opacity` of the SVG element without further validations.

Attributes:

  * `offset` {`string`} - Defines where the gradient stop is placed along the gradient vector

  * `color` {`string`} - Defines the color of the gradient stop

  * `opacity` {`number`} - Defines the opacity of the gradient stop

Properties:

  * `tagName` {`"igc-circular-gradient"`} - 

  * `offset` {`string`} - Defines where the gradient stop is placed along the gradient vector

  * `color` {`string`} - Defines the color of the gradient stop

  * `opacity` {`number`} - Defines the opacity of the gradient stop

tags.name: igc-range-slider
tags.description:
A range slider component used to select two numeric values within a range.

Events:

  * `igcInput` {} - Emitted when a value is changed via thumb drag or keyboard interaction.

  * `igcChange` {} - Emitted when a value change is committed on a thumb drag end or keyboard interaction.

Attributes:

  * `lower` {`number`} - The current value of the lower thumb.

  * `upper` {`number`} - The current value of the upper thumb.

  * `aria-label-lower` {`string`} - The aria label of the lower thumb.

  * `aria-label-upper` {`string`} - The aria label of the upper thumb.

  * `min` {`number`} - The minimum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 0.

  * `max` {`number`} - The maximum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 100.

  * `lower-bound` {`number | undefined`} - The lower bound of the slider value. If not set, the `min` value is applied.

  * `upper-bound` {`number | undefined`} - The upper bound of the slider value. If not set, the `max` value is applied.

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Disables the UI interactions of the slider.

  * `discrete-track` {`boolean`} - Marks the slider track as discrete so it displays the steps.
If the `step` is 0, the slider will remain continuos even if `discreteTrack` is `true`.

  * `hide-tooltip` {`boolean`} - Hides the thumb tooltip.

  * `step` {`number`} - Specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to.
If set to 0 no stepping is implied and any value in the range is allowed.

  * `primary-ticks` {`number`} - The number of primary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no primary ticks are displayed.

  * `secondary-ticks` {`number`} - The number of secondary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no secondary ticks are displayed.

  * `tick-orientation` {`"start" | "end" | "mirror"`} - Changes the orientation of the ticks.

  * `hide-primary-labels` {`boolean`} - Hides the primary tick labels.

  * `hide-secondary-labels` {`boolean`} - Hides the secondary tick labels.

  * `locale` {`string`} - The locale used to format the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

  * `value-format` {`string | undefined`} - String format used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

  * `tick-label-rotation` {`0 | 90 | -90`} - The degrees for the rotation of the tick labels. Defaults to 0.

Properties:

  * `_lowerBound` {`number | undefined`} -

  * `_min` {`number`} -

  * `_step` {`number`} - 

  * `startValue` {`number | undefined`} - 

  * `pointerCaptured` {`boolean`} - 

  * `thumbHoverTimer` - 

  * `activeThumb` {`HTMLElement | undefined`} - 

  * `thumbLabelsVisible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `labels` {`string[] | undefined`} - 

  * `min` {`number`} - The minimum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 0.

  * `max` {`number`} - The maximum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 100.

If the `step` is 0, the slider will remain continuos even if `discreteTrack` is `true`.

If set to 0 no stepping is implied and any value in the range is allowed.

  * `primaryTicks` {`number`} - The number of primary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no primary ticks are displayed.

  * `secondaryTicks` {`number`} - The number of secondary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no secondary ticks are displayed.

  * `tickOrientation` {`"start" | "end" | "mirror"`} - Changes the orientation of the ticks.

tags.name: igc-snackbar
tags.description:
A snackbar component is used to provide feedback about an operation
by showing a brief message at the bottom of the screen.

Events:

  * `igcAction` {} - Emitted when the snackbar action button is clicked.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Renders the snackbar content.

Attributes:

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the snackbar is opened.

tags.name: igc-tree-item
tags.description:
The tree-item component represents a child item of the tree component or another tree item.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Renders nested tree-item component.

  * `label` {} - Renders the tree item container.

  * `indicator` {} - Renders the expand indicator container.

  * `loading` {} - Renders the tree item loading indicator container.

  * `indentation` {} - Renders the container (by default the space) before the tree item.

Attributes:

  * `label` {`string`} - The tree item label.

  * `expanded` {`boolean`} - The tree item expansion state.

  * `active` {`boolean`} - Marks the item as the tree's active item.

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Get/Set whether the tree item is disabled. Disabled items are ignored for user interactions.

  * `selected` {`boolean`} - The tree item selection state.

  * `loading` {`boolean`} - To be used for load-on-demand scenarios in order to specify whether the item is loading data.

  * `value` - The value entry that the tree item is visualizing. Required for searching through items.

tags.name: igc-tree
tags.description:
The tree allows users to represent hierarchical data in a tree-view structure,
maintaining parent-child relationships, as well as to define static tree-view structure without a corresponding data model.

Events:

  * `igcSelection` {} - Emitted when item selection is changing, before the selection completes.

  * `igcItemCollapsed` {} - Emitted when tree item is collapsed.

  * `igcItemCollapsing` {} - Emitted when tree item is about to collapse.

  * `igcItemExpanded` {} - Emitted when tree item is expanded.

  * `igcItemExpanding` {} - Emitted when tree item is about to expand.

  * `igcItemActivated` {} - Emitted when the tree's `active` item changes.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Renders the tree items inside default slot.

Attributes:

  * `single-branch-expand` {`boolean`} - Whether a single or multiple of a parent's child items can be expanded.

  * `selection` {`"multiple" | "none" | "cascade"`} - The selection state of the tree.

  * `dir` {`Direction`} - The direction attribute of the control.

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.

Properties:

  * `tagName` {`"igc-tree"`} - 

  * `styles` - 

  * `singleBranchExpand` {`boolean`} - Whether a single or multiple of a parent's child items can be expanded.

  * `selection` {`"multiple" | "none" | "cascade"`} - The selection state of the tree.

  * `dir` {`Direction`} - The direction attribute of the control.

  * `items` {`IgcTreeItemComponent[]`} - Returns all of the tree's items.

  * `selectionService` - 

  * `navService` - 

  * `size` {"small" | "medium" | "large"} - Determines the size of the component.
